body:
>As you can see, two actions happen when the mouse wheel is clicked, Paste and PasteSelection. That appears to be issue to me. An event should not trigger two actions.

That's intended. Event could trigger as many actions as it wants if user specified a lot of them. And this is a feature.

I think the issue is that your binding doesn't prune the one without a `Shift`? But macOS shouldn't have a binding without a shift to paste with middle button...

Also, do you really need a binding? I think it'll work just fine with `Shift + middle` button? Since `Shift` is a modifier to exit mouse mode and invoke terminal action, thus `Paste` will just work.

Ah, I see. You want to `preserve habbit`. Then just unbind middle button with

```toml
[[mouse.bindings]]
mouse = "Middle"
action = "ReceiveChar"
```

Maybe `action = "None"` will also work.

Yes, both work. Thank you! Sure, simple middle click stops working, but I can live with it. Shift-Middle works everywhere as it should.

However, I'm not convinced that it's the best default behavior to combine actions for the actual event and for the "surrogate" event (i.e. the one without Shift in this case). I believe the "surrogate" event should only be triggered if no action is defined for the actual event.

We don't combine, we replace and let you re-define. it's just with mouse we have that implicit `Shift` thing in mouse mode. With normal bindings we'll nuke all the default ones.

That's the reason I kept the issue open, since I'm not sure what to do about the mouse bindings with `Shift`, maybe we should have a different replace strategy for mouse, as in, exclude the mods.

One solution could be to check if after applying `Shift` there's an actual binding with the same set of mods and ignore the one you've applied shift to.

So if have `Middle` and `Shift + Middle`, `Middle` will be ignored, since there's one with the same mods already. The main issue is making it not that complicated, since mouse bindings are already a niche thing and we already have a set of bindings you can't re-define, so making it more complex isn't an option.

issue.title: Prefer exact matches for bindings in mouse mode
issue.body:
Only consider bindings without Shift if there are no actions defined for the actual mouse event.

Fixes #7292
